resources.string: Collect patients\' various health status to android devices.
Use this for the first time?\nNeed to register! \nPlease go the the website below.
Failed to download list of parks.\n\nMake sure you have network coverage before trying again.
Please wait while downloading weeds info and pictures.
Attempting to download new plant list...

What\'s Invasive! for Android is designed to automatically upload user data to our What\'s Invasive servers. Would you like to set automatic upload on now? (Note: You can change this value later in Settings)
Take photo by pressing camera button or center directional pad.
\nTo edit or delete your previous observations, please visit us at our webpage:
The “Map a Weed!” button is the main function.

When connected, your phone will automatically download a list of participating parks. If GPS is enabled, your phone will also automatically select the closest park.\n\nIf you wish to manually select a park from the list, go to:
Your phone will also download the current list of top invasive weeds for you to look out for. You will be automatically notified of a change in the list of weeds. To manually update the list, go to:
Your phone will upload your observations automatically. You may turn off automatic upload if you have no reception or want to concerve battery life.

It will allow you to do two things:

(1) See a list of the top invasive plants

(2) Record an observation of an invasive plant.
Your observations are kept in the Queue for 1 minute to allow you to review and delete them before they are sent to our database.
From the list of top invasive plants:
Touch the photo of the plant with the blue icon for more information.
After clicking the \"Map a Weed!\" button:
To record an observation of an invasive plant:
(a) Select the quantity of weeds that you see.
(b) Select if you want to include a photo.
(c) Then touch the name of the plant to make your observation!
The \"My Results\" button will take you to your personal statistics:
You can also switch between statistics for you and all participants after clicking the MENU button on the phone.
If there are more than one user on your phone, you may switch users by resetting the login.

You may wish to turn off automatic upload if you are in an area with no reception or want to conserve battery life.\n\nOtherwise, your observations are automatically uploaded after 1 minute in the Queue.

When connected, your phone will automatically download a list of parks.

If GPS is enabled, your phone will automatically select the park closest to you and download its list of top invasive plants.

The selected park is displayed on the main page.
This will present a list of parks if you wish to manually select a park and turn off Auto-location.
You will be automatically notified of any change in the list of top invasive plants. This option is then required to manually update the list.
Select the park you are visiting to download the appropriate invasive plant list:
Select the quantity of weeds that you see.
Select if you want to include a photo.
We recommend that you include at least one photo of each new plant species you are recording.
Then touch the name of the plant to make your observation!
Unable to download tag list. Park does not exist.
Login timed out.\n\nMake sure you have network coverage.
The username and password cannot be empty.
It will allow you to do two things:
See the list of the top invasive plants.
Record an observation of an invasive plant.

What's Invasive! cannot access your location information.

You must enable the GPS satellites before proceeding.
If you choose not to, your park location will be set to the default park.
What\'s Invasive cannot access your location information.\n\nYour submissions will be uploaded normally, but you will have to set a location manually using the website.
A What\'s Invasive Update is available:\n
New Version of What\'s Invasive is Available
New Version of What\'s Invasive is Required
Please Uninstall the old version, go to the Android Market and search for "Invasive" for the new version.\n Update Details:\n

What\'s Invasive! for Android is designed to automatically upload user data to our What\'s Invasive servers. Would you like to set automatic upload on now? (Note: You can change this value later in Settings)
Please wait while downloading weeds and thumbnails.
Please wait while the plant list updates for the first time...

Your observations above are waiting to be sent to the server.

You may select any observation above to view or delete at this time.

Visit http://whatsinvasive.com to edit or delete your previously uploaded observations.
There is no associated location with this tag.
Plant list download failed: HTTP timeout.
Plant list download failed: No response from server.
What\'s Invasive finished uploading all tags.
Weed Mapped!\n\nYour observation will be in the Queue for 1 minute before upload.
GPS disabled, using Network location mode.
Network and GPS location modes disabled.
